intro: Astragalus lamalaensis, commonly known as the Lamala milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellow to green flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Astragalus lamalaensis is often found in alpine meadows and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
